results.question: First filter the chart to only show Avila Adobe, and then identify if there is a consistent underlying monthly visitor trend.
results.answer: Yes, there is a consistent underlying monthly visitor trend for Avila Adobe. The data shows a clear seasonal pattern that repeats annually, with summer months (June-August) consistently drawing peak visitors of 35,000-40,000, while winter months (December-February) show consistent lows around 15,000-20,000 visitors. This cyclical pattern persists throughout the entire 5-year period, though there is an overall declining trend in visitor numbers from 2016 onwards.
key_insights: Avila Adobe visitor data now isolated and clearly visible as a single blue line
Data spans approximately 5 years from 2014 to 2019
Visible fluctuations with peaks around 40,000+ visitors and valleys around 15,000 visitors
There appears to be some cyclical variation but need deeper analysis to confirm monthly patterns
Clear seasonal pattern with summer peaks (June-August) reaching 35,000-40,000 visitors and winter valleys (December-February) around 15,000-20,000 visitors
Consistent annual cycle repeats across all 5 years, indicating strong monthly visitor trend
Overall declining trend from 2016 onwards, with peak visitor periods becoming less pronounced
The seasonal amplitude remains relatively consistent despite the overall decline

reasoning_rounds.reasoning: Successfully filtered the chart to show only Avila Adobe visitor data. I can now see the isolated trend line for this museum spanning from 2014 to 2019. The line shows significant variation with peaks and valleys throughout the time period. I can observe general patterns but need to use trend analysis tools to better identify consistent monthly patterns.

After filtering to show only Avila Adobe data, I can analyze the visitor patterns over the 5-year period from 2014-2019. The chart shows clear seasonal fluctuations with recurring patterns. I observe higher visitor counts during summer months (peaks around 35,000-40,000) and lower counts during winter months (valleys around 15,000-20,000). There's also a general declining trend from the peak years of 2014-2016 to the later years of 2017-2019.
